    • Class Game extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • p1

          Player p1

        • p2

          Player p2

        • current_player

          Player current_player

        • gameAlive

          boolean gameAlive
          This field represents whether the game is ongoing or finished. Its initial value is true, and it is only to be toggle to false when Game.endGame(Player) is invoked.

          Many listeners check this field's value first before responding to player's commands.

          See Also:
          Game.endGame(Player)

        • playerLeaderImage

          javax.swing.JLabel playerLeaderImage
          This label contains the leader image of the first player. It has a MouseListener that picks up left click event when appropriate according to the status of Game.selection;
          See Also:
          Game.selection, Game.Selection

        • enemyLeaderImage

          javax.swing.JLabel enemyLeaderImage
          This label contains the leader image of the second player. It has a MouseListener that picks up left click event when appropriate according to the status of Game.selection;
          See Also:
          Game.selection, Game.Selection

        • gameGuideText

        • enemyEvolveButton

        • endRoundButton

          javax.swing.JButton endRoundButton

        • selection

          Game.Selection selection
          Represents the identity/behaviour of the next card clicked. Player should select their target according to this field value.

          When it's value is Game.Selection.ATTACK, it will hold the attacker Follower and attacker Player. They can later be acquired by invoking its Game.Selection.getAttackerPlayer() and Game.Selection.getAttacker()

          When there is no action taking place on the next click, its value will be Game.Selection.PEND

          See Also:
          Game.Selection

    • Class Grave extends CardList implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • necromancy

          int necromancy
          Necromancy keeps track of cards in the grave. It can be consumed to activate special/advanced effects for Leader.LeaderType.SHADOWCRAFT cards. Upon consumption, the grave's size will decrease simultaneously as well.
